availability.p: All research and writing of Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition annotations was undertaken by project staff, volunteers, and interns. Each record contains citations to relevant primary and secondary source material. All annotations are copyright Kentucky Historical Society, and should be referenced as such in any published work.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

person.persName: Gilbert M. Mulligan (Allen County, KY, attorney)

body.p: Allen County, Kentucky, attorney. Kentucky native. Married to Mary W. Johns Mulligan in Henderson County, Kentucky, on October 18, 1848. Father of Mary F. Mulligan and Lucy N. Mulligan. Married to Lucy D. Tate Mulligan. Father of Rory O. Mulligan. Attorney in Allen County, Kentucky, in 1850. Owned two enslaved persons in Allen County in 1850. Attorney in Allen County in 1860. Owned three enslaved persons in Allen County in 1860. Served in the 9th Kentucky Volunteer Infantry Regiment (U.S.A.) as a captain from November 26, 1861, to May 1, 1862.
